page.title: 01 Barham.General Information.
page.content: Our survey area lies south and east of Barham,where our school is situated.It is a lightly-populated {rural area}of natural beauty,with many farms and areas of woodland.Barham,in the north-west corner of the map,is the largest village,and the villages of Denton in the south and Woolage Green in the north-east are the main centres of population.The area has a central position in East Kent,and it is approximately 10 miles from the Channel ports of Dover and Folkestone.Heavy traffic,including much holiday traffic travelling between London and the coast,uses the A2 trunk road,which passes through the area.The Kent coalfield is nearby,and the city of Canterbury is 6 miles away.Many historical events have taken place in the vicinity.
